description: From Middle English modifien, from Middle French modifier, from Latin modificare (“to limit, control, regulate, deponent”), from modificari (“to measure off, set bound to, moderate”), from modus (“measure”) + facere (“to make”); see mode.

verbs.description: modify (third-person singular simple present modifies, present participle modifying, simple past and past participle modified)

examples: Her publisher advised her to modify a few parts of the book to make it easier to read.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To set bounds to; to moderate.
(grammar, transitive) To qualify the meaning of.
